name: Lunchtime Wind-Down
description: The energy dips. People are taking breaks, making tea, pretending they're going to go for a walk. The show is companionable without being demanding. More listener requests get read out during this slot.

presenters.notes: Mostly duo for companionable conversation during lunch

tone.mood: Relaxed, acknowledging the afternoon slump, companionable

sample_lines: It's just gone midday. Time to stare into the fridge and pretend there's something different in there than there was this morning.
That was 'Rainy Lunch Break' for everyone eating a meal deal at their desk. We see you.
Shout out to everyone who said they were going for a walk and then just stood in the kitchen for five minutes.
That was 'Midday Thoughts' requested by James. James, enjoy your lunch.

handover.style: Relaxed transition from lunch to afternoon, acknowledging the energy shift

winter.tone_adjustment: Reference darkness already setting in, cold lunch breaks, staying inside

summer.tone_adjustment: Reference nice weather, actually going outside, sunshine

christmas_period.tone_adjustment: Acknowledge holiday lunch, time with family, festive food
christmas_period.notes: Some people still working, keep it inclusive
